alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Fort Bend; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 05 at 3:52PM CDT until June 05 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Fort Bend and Harris. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 352 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Western Pearland, Sugar Land, Missouri City, Stafford, First Colony, Fresno, Town West, Mission Bend, eastern Eldridge / West Oaks, Meadows Place, Arcola, Fifth Street, Fondren Gardens, Brays Oaks, Fort Bend Houston, Westbury, Westwood, Braeburn, Riverstone and Meyerland Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
